name: vultr
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Vultr cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`vultr` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/vultr/terraform-provider-vultr).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Vultr cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/vultr/terraform-provider-vultr)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-vultr` repo](https://github.com/dirien/pulumi-vultr/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-vultr` repo](https://github.com/vultr/terraform-provider-vultr/issues).

apiKey.description: The API Key that allows interaction with the API

rateLimit.description: Allows users to set the speed of API calls to work with the Vultr Rate Limit

retryLimit.description: Allows users to set the maximum number of retries allowed for a failed API call.

clusterTimeZone.description: The configured time zone for the Managed Database in TZ database format (e.g. `UTC`, `America/New_York`, `Europe/London`).

databaseEngine.description: The database engine of the new managed database.

databaseEngineVersion.description: The database engine version of the new managed database.

dateCreated.description: The date the managed database was added to your Vultr account.

dbname.description: The managed database's default logical database.

evictionPolicy.description: The configuration value for the data eviction policy on the managed database (Valkey engine types only - `noeviction`, `allkeys-lru`, `volatile-lru`, `allkeys-random`, `volatile-random`, `volatile-ttl`, `volatile-lfu`, `allkeys-lfu`).

ferretdbCredentials.description: An associated list of FerretDB connection credentials (FerretDB + PostgreSQL engine types only).

host.description: The hostname assigned to the managed database.

id.description: The ID of the managed database.

label.description: A label for the managed database.

latestBackup.description: The date of the latest backup available on the managed database.

maintenanceDow.description: The preferred maintenance day of week for the managed database.

maintenanceTime.description: The preferred maintenance time for the managed database in 24-hour HH:00 format (e.g. `01:00`, `13:00`, `23:00`).

mysqlLongQueryTime.description: The configuration value for the long query time (in seconds) on the managed database (MySQL engine types only).

mysqlRequirePrimaryKey.description: The configuration value for whether primary keys are required on the managed database (MySQL engine types only).

mysqlSlowQueryLog.description: The configuration value for slow query logging on the managed database (MySQL engine types only).

mysqlSqlModes.description: A list of SQL modes to configure for the managed database (MySQL engine types only - `ALLOW_INVALID_DATES`, `ANSI`, `ANSI_QUOTES`, `ERROR_FOR_DIVISION_BY_ZERO`, `HIGH_NOT_PRECEDENCE`, `IGNORE_SPACE`, `NO_AUTO_VALUE_ON_ZERO`, `NO_DIR_IN_CREATE`, `NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION`, `NO_UNSIGNED_SUBTRACTION`, `NO_ZERO_DATE`, `NO_ZERO_IN_DATE`, `ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY`, `PIPES_AS_CONCAT`, `REAL_AS_FLOAT`, `STRICT_ALL_TABLES`, `STRICT_TRANS_TABLES`, `TIME_TRUNCATE_FRACTIONAL`, `TRADITIONAL`).

password.description: The password for the managed database's primary admin user.

plan.description: The ID of the plan that you want the managed database to subscribe to. [See List Managed Database Plans](https://www.vultr.com/api/#tag/managed-databases/operation/list-database-plans)

planDisk.description: The description of the disk(s) on the managed database.

planRam.description: The amount of memory available on the managed database in MB.

planReplicas.description: The number of standby nodes available on the managed database (excluded for Kafka engine types).

planVcpus.description: The number of virtual CPUs available on the managed database.

port.description: The connection port for the managed database.

publicHost.description: The public hostname assigned to the managed database (VPC-attached only).

region.description: The ID of the region that the managed database is to be created in. [See List Regions](https://www.vultr.com/api/#operation/list-regions)

status.description: The current status of the managed database (poweroff, rebuilding, rebalancing, configuring, running).

tag.description: The tag to assign to the managed database.

trustedIps.description: A list of allowed IP addresses for the managed database.

user.description: The primary admin user for the managed database.

vpcId.description: The ID of the VPC Network to attach to the Managed Database.

aclCategories.description: The list of command category rules for this managed database user.

aclChannels.description: The list of publish/subscribe channel patterns for this managed database user.

aclCommands.description: The list of individual command rules for this managed database user.

aclKeys.description: The list of access rules for this managed database user.

dom.description: Day of month to run. Use values between 1 and 28.

dow.description: Day of week to run. `1 = Sunday`, `2 = Monday`, `3 = Tuesday`, `4 = Wednesday`, `5 = Thursday`, `6 = Friday`, `7 = Saturday`

hour.description: Hour of day to run in UTC.

type.description: Type of backup schedule Possible values are `daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`, `daily_alt_even`, or `daily_alt_odd`.

autoScaler.description: Enable the auto scaler for the default node pool.

dateCreated.description: Date node was created.

id.description: ID of node.

label.description: The label to be used as a prefix for nodes in this node pool.

labels.description: A map of key/value pairs for Kubernetes node labels.

maxNodes.description: The maximum number of nodes to use with the auto scaler.

minNodes.description: The minimum number of nodes to use with the auto scaler.

nodeQuantity.description: The number of nodes in this node pool.

nodes.description: Array that contains information about nodes within this node pool.

plan.description: The plan to be used in this node pool. [See Plans List](https://www.vultr.com/api/#operation/list-plans) Note the minimum plan requirements must have at least 1 core and 2 gbs of memory.

status.description: Status of node.

taints.description: Taints to apply to the nodes in the node pool. Should contain `key`, `value` and `effect`.  The `effect` should be one of `NoSchedule`, `PreferNoSchedule` or `NoExecute`.

dateCreated.description: Date node was created.

id.description: ID of node.

label.description: The label to be used as a prefix for nodes in this node pool.

status.description: Status of node.

id.description: The load balancer ID.

ipType.description: The type of ip this rule is - may be either v4 or v6.

port.description: The assigned port (integer) on the attached instances that the load balancer should check against. Default value is `80`.

source.description: IP address with subnet that is allowed through the firewall. You may also pass in `cloudflare` which will allow only CloudFlares IP range.

backendProtocol.description: Protocol on instance side. Possible values: "http", "https", "tcp".

frontendProtocol.description: Protocol on load balancer side. Possible values: "http", "https", "tcp".

checkInterval.description: Time in seconds to perform health check. Default value is 15.

healthyThreshold.description: Number of failed attempts encountered before failover. Default value is 5.

path.description: The path on the attached instances that the load balancer should check against. Default value is `/`

port.description: The assigned port (integer) on the attached instances that the load balancer should check against. Default value is `80`.

protocol.description: The protocol used to traffic requests to the load balancer. Possible values are `http`, or `tcp`. Default value is `http`.

responseTimeout.description: Time in seconds to wait for a health check response. Default value is 5.

unhealthyThreshold.description: Number of failed attempts encountered before failover. Default value is 5.

provider.description:
The provider type for the vultr package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.
